summary: This bill, the 9/11 Memorial and Museum Act, proposes a one-time grant for the National September 11 Memorial & Museum for operation, security, and maintenance. The Secretary of Homeland Security will award the grant, with the amount between $5 and $10 million, considering the museum's needs, visitor impact, preservation efforts, and ability to serve disadvantaged visitors. The recipient must provide free admission to certain groups and allow for federal audits. Reports to relevant committees are required. The bill specifies that funds are subject to the availability of appropriations.
